title: Landing and Taking Off
content:
Landing and Taking Off

State Regulations
§ 1261.20 - Port Authority may prohibit aircraft from landing or taking off under certain circumstances
§ 1261.21 - Compliance with FAA and NTB rules and regulations required
§ 1261.22 - Landing of aircraft without two-way radio restricted
§ 1261.23 - Landing of helicopters without two-way radio restricted
§ 1261.24 - Permission to land or take-off motorless aircraft required
§ 1261.25 - Permission to land or take-off jet or turbo-prop aircraft required
§ 1261.26 - Permission for jet-assisted take-offs required
§ 1261.27 - Student landings, take-offs or taxiing prohibited
§ 1261.28 - Permission for practice landings or take-offs required
§ 1261.29 - Use of landing areas designated as unsafe prohibited
§ 1261.30 - Aircraft landing required to leave line of traffic promptly
§ 1261.31 - Gross weight of aircraft using La Guardia Airport restricted
§ 1261.32 - Gross weight of aircraft using Newark Airport restricted
§ 1261.33 - Gross weight of aircraft using West 30th Street Heliport restricted
§ 1261.34 - Gross weight of aircraft using Kennedy International Airport restricted

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
